author: gpduck
body:
## PR Summary

Update the shortcut created by the installer to use %HOMEDRIVE%%HOMEPATH% for the working directory.

Fixes #5705

comments.author: TravisEz13
comments.body: Wouldn't this script only set the correct path for the user that installed PowerShell?

comments.author: gpduck
comments.body: It sets the value to the literal string "%HOMEDRIVE%%HOMEPATH%" which is then resolved at launch time to the current user's path.

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body: @gpduck Can you confirm that the shortcut correctly removed in uninstall time?

comments.author: gpduck
comments.body: @iSazonov Yes, I just verified with the artifact from AppVeyor that the shortcut is properly removed on uninstall.

title: Add script to set the shortcut working directory to the user's home folder.
